result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Staniszewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Sentence credit of 27 days were granted
if imposed.
Probation may be transferred to Sauk County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Attend 2 Self-Help meetings per week.

No Violent contact with the victim. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion. If agent imposes, may be served in Sauk County.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Michael J Staniszewski in court with Attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Smith makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 27 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS         **May be transferred to Sauk County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling  - complete HSED
____No violent contact with: victim
____Attend 2 self-help meeting per week 

COSTS:  $343.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion (May be served in Sauk County, if ever imposed) 


COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS HUBER     **CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #4 & CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1**

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS         **May be transferred to Sauk County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling  - complete HSED
____No violent contact with: victim
____Attend 2 self-help meeting per week 

COSTS:  $343.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #4:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS HUBER     **CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #2 & CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1**

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS         **May be transferred to Sauk County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs

____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling  - complete HSED
____No violent contact with: victim
____Attend 2 self-help meeting per week 

COSTS:  $343.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Sentencing hearing on August 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael J Staniszewski in court with Attorney Joseph Smith.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Counts #1, 2 and 4 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1, 2 and 4 on amended information.  Counts #3, 5 and 6 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Smith requests a sentencing date and state also needs to comply with victims rights legislation.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
